sourceText: Ara Ahl al-Madina al-Fadila (The Virtuous City); Kitab al-Siyasa al-Madaniyya
note: Islamic Neoplatonic emanation hierarchy. Four emanation levels: (1) God, (2) First through Ninth Intellects generating the celestial spheres, (3) Tenth/Active Intellect, (4) Material/sublunary world. Each intellect emanates from the one above by contemplating both itself and the First Cause. The material world divides into three levels of human attainment. Arabic planet names: Zuhal (Saturn), Mushtari (Jupiter), Mirrikh (Mars), Shams (Sun), Zuhrah (Venus), 'Utarid (Mercury), Qamar (Moon).

God.description: Unified, uncaused source — beyond unity and multiplicity, from whom all else proceeds by necessary emanation

First Intellect.description: Emanates directly from God — generates the first heaven (outermost sphere)

Second Intellect — Stars.description: Arises from the First Intellect — generates the sphere of the fixed stars

Third Intellect — Saturn.description: Emanates from the Second Intellect — three contemplating two, generating the sphere of Saturn

Fourth Intellect — Jupiter.description: From the Third contemplating the Second — generates the sphere of Jupiter

Fifth Intellect — Mars.description: From the Fourth contemplating the Third — generates the sphere of Mars

Sixth Intellect — Sun.description: From the Fifth contemplating the Fourth — generates the sphere of the Sun

Seventh Intellect — Venus.description: From the Sixth contemplating the Fifth — generates the sphere of Venus

Eighth Intellect — Mercury.description: From the Seventh contemplating the Sixth — generates the sphere of Mercury

Ninth Intellect — Moon.description: From the Eighth contemplating the Seventh — generates the sphere of the Moon

Tenth Intellect — Active Agent.description: Emanates from the Moon sphere — restores intelligibles to the sublunary world like light to sight, the Philosopher King and Prophet Philosopher arise here

Material World — Acquired.description: Highest attainment in the sublunary realm — philosophers, sages, and scholars who align with the Active Intellect

Material World — Actual.description: Middle attainment — judges, poets, theologians, and teachers who work with received knowledge

Material World — Potential.description: Lowest attainment — the masses, guided by story, law, and spiritual instruction rather than direct philosophy
